Pre-Game Insights: The New York Yankees and Chicago Cubs are set to meet on September 8, 2024, at Wrigley Field.
The game will be broadcast on MARQUEE and YES.
Gerrit Cole will start for the New York Yankees, while Jameson Taillon will start for the Chicago Cubs.
Betting Odds: The betting odds for the game are: Chicago Cubs +128 / New York Yankees -152
Recent Betting Trends: Each of the Cubs' last four home games against AL East opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Five of the Yankees' last six games after playing the previous day have gone OVER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Cubs' last eight Sunday day games at Wrigley Field.
Player Prop Facts (Cubs): Cody Bellinger has hit at least one home run in four of his last eight appearances with the Cubs as home underdogs against AL opponents.
Nico Hoerner has scored a run in eight of the Cubs' last nine Sunday games against opponents that held a winning record.
Cody Bellinger has recorded at least one Single in 14 of his last 16 appearances with the Cubs as underdogs.
Cody Bellinger has recorded at least one hit in each of his last 11 appearances with the Cubs as underdogs against AL opponents.
Patrick Wisdom has recorded two or more total bases in five of his last six appearances against AL opponents that held a winning record.
Player Prop Facts (Yankees): Aaron Judge has recorded at least one RBI in four of the Yankees' last five games against opponents that held a winning record.
Gleyber Torres has recorded at least one Single in each of the Yankees' last eight games as favorites.
Aaron Judge has scored at least one run in eight of the Yankees' last nine road games against NL opponents that held a winning record.
Anthony Volpe has recorded at least one total base in each of the Yankees' last 11 games against opponents that held a winning record.
DJ LeMahieu has hit a home run in each of his last two appearances in day games against teams that held a winning record.
DJ LeMahieu has recorded at least one hit in each of his last 12 appearances against former teams.
Matchup/League Facts: The Chicago Cubs rank 7th in the league for ERA this season (3.76).
The Chicago Cubs are one of only 7 teams in the league to rank top 10 in both ERA and hits allowed this season.
The New York Yankees rank 2nd in the league for runs scored this season (719).
The New York Yankees rank 2nd in the league for RBI's this season (692).
